author: Sarah Toy
title: Flu Season May Be Slowing, But Is Still Serious
text:
There are signs that the flu season is slowing downâ€”at least for now, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
The proportion of all outpatient and emergency-department visits for flu symptoms, the main measure for flu activity, held steady during the week ended Feb. 10, staying at 7.5%. Deaths from influenza and pneumonia, a common flu complication, dropped to 9.8% for the week ended Jan. 27 from 10.4% the week before.
